content: As a result, our total revenue for the second quarter decreased 3.5% year-over-year to $52.3 million, which was below our expectations. Total revenue for our data center product of $21.5 million, decreased 4% year-over-year and what essentially phrase . As a result, our total revenue for the second quarter decreased 3.5% year-over-year to $52.3 million, which was below our expectations and essentially flat compared to Q1. However, for the reasons I mentioned earlier related to the orders that slipped from Q2 into Q3, we generated CATV revenue of $23.7 million down 14.1% year-over-year and down 5.1% sequentially. Our Q2 data center revenue came in at $21.5 million down 4% year-over-year, and up 0.4% sequentially. Now turning to our telecom segments, revenue from our telecom products of $6.3 million was up at 88.3% year-over-year, and up 19.2% sequentially. Totaled non-GAAP operating expenses in the second quarter were $18.2 million, or 34.9% of revenue, down from $20 million, or 36.9% of revenue in Q2 of the prior year. Non GAAP operating loss in the second quarter was $9.5 million, compared to an operating loss of $6.5 million in Q2 of the prior year. On a non GAAP basis, net loss for Q2 was $7.6 million, or a loss of $0.28 cents per basic share, which was better than our guidance range of a loss of $8.4 million to $9.5 million, or loss per share and the range of $0.30 to $0.34 cents per basic share and compares to a net loss of $4.1 million or a loss of $0.15 cents per basic Share. Moving out to our Q3 outlook, we expect Q3 revenue to be between $57 million and $60 million and non GAAP gross margin to be in the range of 16.5% to 18.5%.
